verbose_text: XREF_BIBR Plasmin is rapidly inhibited by its major inhibitor alpha2-antiplasmin (alpha2-AP), and to a lesser extent by alpha2-macroglobulin (alpha2M), unless it remains bound to fibrin or to its cell surface receptors (XREF_FIG).
evidence: Plasmin is rapidly inhibited by its major inhibitor alpha2-antiplasmin (alpha2-AP), and to a lesser extent by alpha2-macroglobulin
